title: Vestland Municipalities Conduct Cybersecurity Exercise
summary: Municipalities in Vestland county conducted a simulated ransomware attack exercise to test crisis management protocols and inter-agency coordination. The exercise involved IT staff, municipal leadership, and emergency services.

title: Pro-Russian Hacktivist Group Targets Norwegian Government Websites
summary: PST (Norwegian Police Security Service) linked a data attack on Norwegian government websites to pro-Russian hacktivist groups. The attack was quickly detected and prevented, but underscores the continued threat from state-sponsored actors.

title: Two U.S. Cybersecurity Professionals Plead Guilty Over ALPHV/BlackCat Ransomware
summary: Two former cybersecurity professionals admitted to working as affiliates for the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware operation. The case has significant symbolic value for trust in the cybersecurity industry, highlighting insider threats and the ethical challenges facing security practitioners.

title: Transparent Tribe Launches New RAT Attacks Against Indian Government
summary: State-sponsored APT group Transparent Tribe launched sophisticated Remote Access Trojan (RAT) campaigns targeting Indian government agencies and academic institutions. The campaign demonstrates continued APT focus on Indian critical infrastructure and intelligence gathering operations.

title: Silver Fox and Mustang Panda Target India with ToneShell Malware
summary: Multiple state-linked APT groups including Silver Fox and Mustang Panda deployed ToneShell malware in coordinated campaigns against Indian targets. The attacks represent escalating cyber operations focused on Indian government and academic sectors.

title: ManageMyHealth Data Breach Affects New Zealand Patients
summary: Major patient portal ManageMyHealth in New Zealand was compromised, exposing sensitive patient health records. The incident has drawn criticism for lack of transparency and inadequate information sharing with affected patients and healthcare providers.

title: Cognizant Faces Multiple Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
summary: Cognizant hit with multiple U.S. class-action lawsuits following a major data breach at TriZetto, its healthcare platform. The incident exemplifies supplier risk in the healthcare sector and the legal consequences of third-party security failures.

title: Belgium Cyber Chief Warns Europe Has 'Lost the Internet'
summary: Belgium's cybersecurity chief issued stark warning that Europe has 'lost the internet' amid escalating attacks on critical infrastructure. The statement reflects growing concerns about physical and digital security convergence in European infrastructure protection.

title: Finland Seizes Ship Suspected of Damaging Subsea Cable
summary: Finnish authorities seized a ship suspected of deliberately damaging undersea telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea. The incident is being investigated as gross sabotage, highlighting physical threats to critical digital infrastructure.

title: Multiple Baltic Sea Cable Breaks Under Investigation as Sabotage
summary: Several undersea cable breaks in the Baltic Sea are being investigated as deliberate acts of sabotage. The incidents demonstrate how physical and digital security are merging, with infrastructure becoming geopolitical targets.

title: New York City Bans Flipper Zero at Official Events
summary: NYC banned Flipper Zero devices and Raspberry Pi at mayoral inauguration, reflecting government struggles to distinguish between hobbyist equipment and actual security threats. The ban highlights tensions between maker culture and security policy.

title: DarkSpectre Campaign Infects 8.8 Million Browser Users
summary: Massive DarkSpectre/Shai-Hulud malware campaign infected 8.8 million users through compromised browser extensions. The supply-chain attack demonstrates browser extensions as a highly scalable attack surface for credential theft and data harvesting.

title: Trust Wallet Chrome Extension Hack Drains $8.5 Million
summary: Attackers compromised Trust Wallet's Chrome extension, draining $8.5 million in cryptocurrency from users. The incident is linked to the broader DarkSpectre browser extension supply-chain attack campaign.

title: Unleash Protocol Hackers Drain $3.9 Million in DeFi Attack
summary: Attackers exploited multisig wallet vulnerabilities to drain $3.9 million from Unleash Protocol. The attack highlights classic DeFi security weaknesses in smart contract implementations and multisignature wallet configurations.

title: Critical Apache NuttX Vulnerability Enables Remote Attacks
summary: Security researchers disclosed critical vulnerability in Apache NuttX RTOS that allows remote code execution. The flaw affects embedded systems and IoT devices, requiring immediate patching.

title: Critical Apache StreamPipes Vulnerability Discovered
summary: Critical security vulnerability found in Apache StreamPipes IoT analytics platform. The vulnerability could allow attackers to compromise industrial IoT data pipelines and analytics systems.

title: IBM Issues Urgent Warning Over API Connect Auth Bypass
summary: IBM issued urgent security advisory for critical authentication bypass vulnerability in API Connect. The enterprise middleware flaw could allow attackers to bypass authentication and access sensitive systems.

title: MongoBleed Vulnerability Exposes MongoDB Databases
summary: Critical MongoBleed vulnerability discovered affecting MongoDB implementations, potentially exposing sensitive data from databases worldwide. The vulnerability highlights ongoing security challenges in open-source database systems.

title: RondoDox Botnet Exploits React2Shell Flaw in Next.js Servers
summary: RondoDox botnet actively exploiting React2Shell vulnerability to compromise Next.js servers. The campaign targets modern web frameworks, demonstrating that popular JavaScript frameworks are high-value targets for attackers.

title: European Space Agency Confirms Data Breach
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) confirmed a cybersecurity breach affecting internal systems. While details remain limited, the incident raises concerns about security of space and scientific research organizations.

title: Knownsec Suffers Data Breach Exposing Security Research Data
summary: Chinese cybersecurity firm Knownsec suffered a data breach exposing security research data and threat intelligence. The incident highlights that even security companies remain vulnerable to sophisticated attacks.

title: Over 10,000 Fortinet Firewalls Exposed to Ongoing 2FA/MFA Bypass Attacks
summary: Large numbers of Internet-exposed Fortinet firewalls remain vulnerable to a years-old 2FA/MFA bypass (CVE-2020-12812), with reports of active exploitation. The vulnerability allows attackers to bypass authentication and take over networks, underscoring the importance of patch hygiene and perimeter hardening.

title: Covenant Health Says May Data Breach Impacted Nearly 478,000 Patients
summary: Covenant Health revised its estimate of people impacted by a data breach discovered in May 2025, after additional analysis increased the total to nearly 478,000 affected individuals. The healthcare breach exposed sensitive patient information.

title: Sedgwick Confirms Cyber Incident Affecting Federal Contractor Subsidiary
summary: Sedgwick confirmed a cybersecurity incident affecting its government-focused subsidiary after the TridentLocker ransomware group claimed responsibility and alleged data theft. The incident affects a major federal contractor subsidiary that provides services to sensitive government agencies.

title: Aflac Notifies 22.6 Million People of June Data Theft Attack
summary: Aflac issued notifications affecting 22.6 million people after a June incident involving unauthorized access and data theft. The massive notification volume underscores the scale of exposure possible in insurance and healthcare data ecosystems.

title: DD-USA Provides Update on Cybersecurity Issue
summary: DD-USA (Daedong-USA / KIOTI Tractor Division) published an update describing the scope of information potentially affected in a cybersecurity incident, including personal and sensitive data categories such as names, contact information, dates of birth, and copies of government-issued IDs.

title: Hackers Abuse Google Tasks Notifications in Sophisticated Phishing Attacks
summary: Cybercriminals abused Google Tasks notification flows to lend legitimacy to phishing messages, targeting over 3,000 organizations primarily in the manufacturing sector. The campaign aims to harvest credentials by bypassing traditional email trust signals and exploiting Google's trusted infrastructure.

title: Cybercriminals Abuse Google Cloud Email Feature in Multi-Stage Phishing Campaign
summary: Attackers abused Google Cloud Application Integration's 'Send Email' feature to deliver phishing messages from Google-branded addresses. The multi-stage campaign pushed victims through captcha lures to credential-harvesting pages, demonstrating sophisticated abuse of trusted cloud services.

title: Cryptocurrency Theft Attacks Traced to 2022 LastPass Breach
summary: Investigators linked ongoing cryptocurrency wallet thefts to material stolen in the 2022 LastPass breach. The incidents illustrate the long-tail risk of encrypted vault theft combined with later cracking, credential reuse, or targeted follow-on activity against crypto holders.

title: Kimwolf Botnet Spreads Across Consumer Devices and Stalks Local Networks
summary: Researchers described Kimwolf as a large Android-based botnet affecting approximately 1.8 million consumer devices including smart TVs, set-top boxes, and tablets. The botnet has significant DDoS capacity and uses Ethereum Name Service (ENS) for infrastructure resilience, with infections concentrated in Brazil, India, US, Argentina, South Africa, and Philippines.

title: European Regulators Take Aim at X After Grok Creates Deepfake of Minor
summary: European regulators weighed action against X (formerly Twitter) after its Grok AI was reportedly used to create sexually explicit deepfake images of a minor. The incident reflects escalating regulatory scrutiny of generative AI misuse and platform controls for preventing AI-generated child abuse material.

title: GNU Wget2 Vulnerability Could Allow Overwrite of Sensitive Files (CVE-2025-69194)
summary: A security flaw in GNU Wget2's handling of Metalink documents can enable path traversal issues that may allow attackers to overwrite arbitrary files on the system. Vendors have published advisories and fixes for the vulnerability affecting this widely-used command-line download utility.
